commits.message: Add initial Danger setup with Dangermattic
Update how activesupport version is locked
Move Dangerfile to project root, per Danger standard

Merge pull request #10654 from woocommerce/add/dangermattic-setup

Dangermattic Setup

pull_request.title: Dangermattic Setup
pull_request.body:
Setting up the use of [Dangermattic](https://github.com/Automattic/dangermattic) checks in the project, replacing the [Peril checks](https://github.com/Automattic/peril-settings/blob/master/peril-settings.json).

These are the checks currently implemented for WCiOS:
- Labels (equivalent to [label.ts](https://github.com/Automattic/peril-settings/blob/master/org/pr/label.ts))
- PR Size (equivalent to [ios-diff-size.ts](https://github.com/Automattic/peril-settings/blob/master/org/pr/ios-diff-size.ts))
- Milestone (equivalent to [milestone.ts](https://github.com/Automattic/peril-settings/blob/master/org/pr/milestone.ts))
- View Changes Need Screenshots (new check)
- Manifest / Lockfile (new check)

##  How to test

You should see a comment stating the warnings / errors present in this PR. As a test, I've also added a "do not merge" label so that Danger also issues an error, and that error should also be reported on CI.

To run Danger yourself:
1. Checkout this branch 
2. Run `bundle install`
3. Run:
```ruby
DANGER_GITHUB_API_TOKEN=<github_token> bundle exec danger pr <PR_URL>
```
You should get in the console the same errors / warnings reported in this PR.

labels.name: category: tooling
labels.description: Anything that involves building & maintaining the project, including scripts, `Fastfile`, etc.

commits.message: Create a separate use case for site discovery

issue.title: Blaze Optimization: Update entry point from Product detail screen
issue.body: - Remove option from dot menu - Create "Promote with Blaze" button instead - Handle navigation upon tapping the button: - If no campaign is available yet, show the intro screen. - Otherwise, navigate to campaign creation. --- Subtasks - [x] UI https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce-ios/pull/10970 - [x] Functionality https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce-ios/pull/11011 - [x] Tracking: add a new Blaze source `product_detail_promote_button` and track `blaze_entry_point_displayed` and `blaze_entry_point_tapped` https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce-ios/pull/11011 - [ ] Hide the promote button if there is an existing campaign for the product

issue.title: Blaze Optimization: Update entry point from Product detail screen

commits.message: Put slash back to end of wp-json
Replace fees with custom amounts in the order payment section
Remove non necessary code and rename properties to make them consistent
Remove the legacy order synchronizer related code
Fix unit test for custom amounts label in order details.
Disable fee logic as it is replaced by custom amounts
Track events for custom amounts in the editable order view model
Add events for the add custom amount screen
Add unit tests for the custom amounts events in the EditableOrderViewModel
Add tests for events in AddCustomAmountViewModel

Merge pull request #11024 from woocommerce/issue/10881-custom-amounts-m1-tracking

[Custom Amounts M1] Tracking

issue.title: [Custom Amounts M1] Remove Feature Flag to enable functionality in Release

labels.name: feature: order creation
labels.description: All tasks related to creating an order

issue.body: Remove also the code we won't need any more: set an unique fee to the order.

pull_request.title: [Custom Amounts M1] Prepare for release
pull_request.body:
<!-- Remember about a good descriptive title. -->

Closes: #10883
<!-- Id number of the GitHub issue this PR addresses. -->

## Description
<!-- Take the time to write a good summary. Why is it needed? What does it do? When fixing bugs try to avoid just writing “See original issue” – clarify what the problem was and how you’ve fixed it. -->
With this PR we prepare the first milestone of the Custom Amounts project for release by:

- Removing the feature flag and related code
- Removing the legacy code related to adding a single fee to the order
- Updating UI fees references to show "Custom amounts" instead
- Updating Unit Tests
- Updating UI Tests (In progress, shouldn't affect this PR review)

## Testing instructions
<!-- Step by step testing instructions. When necessary break out individual scenarios that need testing, consider including a checklist for the reviewer to go through. -->

Please make sure that the custom amounts functionality works on Release. Also, see that we don't have references to "fees" neither in order creation or order details:

https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce-ios/assets/1864060/66343775-686b-40fb-a4f8-2cebd6d94245

---
- [X] I have considered if this change warrants user-facing release notes and have added them to `RELEASE-NOTES.txt` if necessary.

requested_teams.description: Team including folks who are knowledgeable about UI testing.
